conclusion: Need to find the work done by the frictional force as an object moves on a conveyor belt from point M to point N.
The object is gently placed on the conveyor belt above point M, and the conveyor belt moves with velocity v = 6 m/s.
The mass of the object is given as m = 3 kg, and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ = 0.3.
The distance between the two drive wheels is L1 = 10 m.
Frictional force opposes the motion of the object relative to the conveyor belt.
Frictional force is calculated as F_friction = μmg.
Work done by the frictional force is W = F_friction × d × cos(θ).
Since the frictional force opposes the displacement, θ = 180°, and cos(180°) = -1.
Calculate the frictional force: F_friction = 0.3 × 3 kg × 10 m/s² = 9 N.
Calculate the work done by the frictional force: W = -9 N × 10 m = -90 J.
The work done by the frictional force as the object is transported from point M to point N is -90 J.
